data.title: index - College of Communications
data.text:
Tracy is a former government reporter, foreign correspondent in Asia, California investigative reporter and editor. She was one of the few women combat correspondents during the Vietnam War. She then joined the Los Angeles Times in California where she was an investigative reporter for 17 years, covering political and government corruption. She was part of the 1992 team that won the Pulitzer Prize for the Times' coverage of the Rodney King riots. Later she became the Orange County Register’s Investigations Editor, leading the paper’s investigations team when it broke the story of former Orange County Sheriff Michael S. Carona’s ties to Nationwide Auction Systems founder and former Assistant Sheriff Donald G. Haidl.

She has won numerous awards for investigative reporting and in 2001 was named Los Angeles Print Journalist of the Year by Sigma Delta Chi, the professional journalism association. She and eight other women reporters from Vietnam co-authored “War Torn, Stories of War from the Women Reporters who Covered Vietnam” (2002 Random House).
